intro: Erismanthus obliquus, commonly known as the oblique erismanthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse morphological characteristics. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems, which are typical features of many species within its family. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, where it can thrive without direct sunlight. Due to its unique appearance and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
